WRITING.TITLE: Obsessed with therapy (always fantasize about it)
WRITING.TEXT: I started therapy 4 weeks ago, it's been 4 sessions now. I went for my anxiety in social situations, that limited and stopped me during an apprenticeship with university. I don't have a diagnosis of social anxiety yet, i mean my therapist never talked about it, never give me some hints. she is using cbt and exposure therapy. I had my last session 3 days ago. Now i always think about it, i see images in my mind of various sessions, i repeat in my mind phrases that my t said to me, or that i said...or i fantasize, for example i have scenarios where my t is comforting me, or where i start to cry (i never did this in therapy, i can't cry in front of people). And i feel anxious. Yesterday i was in a panic state, because i have some homework she assigned to me. I have to write my thoughts, my emotions, in which situations they are present, my behaviour, and some alternative ways of thinking instead of my warped thoughts. I'm anxious about it, sometimes i can't find a specific situation, for example when i think "i'm no good enough, im stupid" nothing happened, im at home, i don't have a situation. And i start to think that maybe i'm doing it wrong, maybe my T is expecting more from me. Another example i have: last session my T arrived late. I was waiting for her, i started shaking, i thought "she hates me, she isn't coming because she's bored, or i'm annoying..." and i felt the need to cry. I'm anxious because maybe she'll get mad at me for not doing things right, or for not doing my homeworks right.... I don't know if this post makes sense...i want to know if some of you experienced this during therapy. Maybe it's like a sort of transfert? .___.

Ok :) thanks. I already told her, two sessions ago, that i was anxious before and during therapy. I said that i had the fear of being judged or criticized by her. She was very nice and supporting - she always is- and reassured me. My anxiety is...irrational! She is always nice, gentle, caring, supporting....i don't have to be afraid of her. But I'm so embarassed to tell her again ._.

WRITING.TITLE: Social anxiety + fear of abandonment?
WRITING.TEXT: Today i had therapy. My T finally told to me that i have social anxiety (she wasnt so explicit, but she mentioned it)...so i told to her the story of it...i didnt have sa in elementary and secondary school. In secondary school (at the age of 11-12) i had two best friends, i was shy but my shyness didnt bother me, i was able to talk in class etc...so at the end of the third and last year, i had a problem with my best friend. She said to me in an unexpected way "you talk only to me and x girl, i think you'll have problems to find friends without us", and then she never talked to me again. I felt very sad, anxious, i felt like a loss...i had lost her. So my t said: maybe you had this fear of abandonment, but it turn into the fear of being criticized? Her point is: during social situations, i think that people are criticizing me, or wil do it, i feel i'm being judged. I think that i have to appear perfect, because if they see my flaws, they will judge me -- gt;and then leave me. So this comes fear of abandonment. Please i want to ask you if this makes sense. I'm not sure...but i have this doubt. Maybe i have this fear, and its linked to social anxiety?? I'm a bit confused...

sometimes i think like this...at least with bipolar you are more able to socialize, to have friends...i know, it's not right to say that. But for me social anxiety is like living hell and somedays i think "i wish i didnt have anxiety but another thing"

I really don't know. I'm stuck in the same situation. I think i am boring with others, because i'm not able to show my emotions, or even to change my tone of voice! When i was in highschool a girl told me something like "are you human?" because i didn't show nothing about me, my emotions etc... Only when i'm drunk, or tipsy, i'm able to show more of myself, i'm cheerful, happy, i speak more...but i can't be drunk everytime. I think you have to try, and try again...to find people with your same interests, or hobbies maybe it's easier to open up.

WRITING.TITLE: SA + distress?
WRITING.TEXT: I have sa and it's been a while that i feel a sense of distress...i don't know how to explain this, and if it's the right name. For example, today i felt a feeling similar to anxiety, but a bit different from it...i felt a heavy sensation in my stomach (a sharp feeling), a sense of emptiness, of boredom, i was tired...sometimes i cry a little or i feel the need to do it. and i stayed at home all day. Does anyone else with sa have this thing? How do you call it?

I noticed that im feeling like this after a therapy session. Therapy sessions drain me...i have anxiety before and during, even if my therapist is really nice, gentle and calm. The sessions are on thursday, so during the weekend i feel really tired and i think about therapy all day. And then this sensation usually fade away during the week.

Yes i do! Fo example, some days i woke up really tired. I noticed that during those days i care more about people because i'm sleepy... i have this thing not only when i'm sleepy, but when i'm very hungry too.

WRITING.TITLE: Why I can't be happy
WRITING.TEXT: I was at home during the weekend. But i felt like i was drained, tired, with negative thinking, thoughts of self harm again (but i didnt do it), i felt the need to cry....i didnt have anxiety. I wasnt in social situations...nothing happened. I feel i'm empty, nothing interests me. i don't know if im fine or not, because im not even sad. Last week was way better...during the week i was a bit tired but i felt happy too. So this thursday i have another appointment with my therapist. I'm really anxious because every session she asks me "How are you?" then i say "fine" and i explain the reasons. Or i will say "i'm ok, i had anxiety during this and that but im ok"...im afraid that this feeling will last. I dont want to tell my therapist that my mood dropped...i know it's sound stupid, because you may say "the therapist is here to help you!" but i feel that if i tell her that i'm not fine, that i feel empty, maybe she will think bad about me, or she will think "you don't have to swallow in your emotion..." Or she may be worried. I feel embarassed....i want to tell her that i had anxiety but i'm fine too, i'm recovering....

Same. I try to appear as calm as possible, sometimes i "copy" other people behaviours...i can't be truly myself, or act like i do when i'm alone. I think that sometimes i give an image of an emotionless person, in the past some people told me if i was human, or if i felt emotions.
Not before sleep because it gives me anxiety. Sometimes when i do a mistake, or i say\do something that bothered me i think about it all day.

Yes, me too! When i'm at home, alone, i'm more confident, i dont have problems with taking photos if i want. When i go out...i think i started to compare myself with others (like "that girl is so beautiful\cute\i want to be like her) and i dont want to look at my reflection because i always find more flaws. Even more when i go to dress stores, i cant face my image on the mirror. I feel so uncomfortable to try clothes on, i think because im so aware of other people presence, and i compare myself to them.
Thank you i'm going to try the app!

WRITING.TITLE: Thinking about my therapist
WRITING.TEXT: It's been 4 weeks that i started therapy for my SA (1 session per week). At the beginning i didnt like her at all. I found her irritating, even if she didn't do anything. In fact she was - and always is- gentle, caring, supportive.... but I didnt want her to be my therapist. I started to have feelings of both love and hate. Due to my SA i was really anxious that she would judge me. After some sessions, one time she was 20 mins late (it was the first time). I panicked, i wanted to cry and started to think "ok, she hates me, she don't want to see me again!". (she arrived and apologized). i was afraid she would leave me. And now, i think i "love" her. I don't hate her, i like her. Last session i feel like i was able to connect more, talk more to her. I thought about flirting with her (im bisexual so i think its because of that), its like im starting to have a crush on her (she is young too, 35 years old). Today i thought about her all day. Im thinking that i dont want to quit therapy, but one day it will happen...and i feel like crying because i don't want to "lose" her, to never see her again...it's painful. Im so ashamed to tell her all of this. I told her a bit of it, only that after therapy i feel drained, and that im really anxious before and after. Do you felt like this during therapy?

Same with me...but for example, some days ago i went out to a party with 2 "friends" of my university. I drank way too much, next morning i felt like shit! I dont want to rely too much on alcohol! Maybe a bit, but i don't want to feel like shit again...
I thought it was love because i wanted to flirt with her. It's like when i have a crush on someone, it's a different feeling.

Yes, i have to tell her. I'm so scared and ashamed...but she's a therapist, maybe she's used to it, she have other clients, i'm not the only one! Anyway, today i felt anxious and at the point of crying of the thought of her leaving me. I don't know how to tell her this...maybe it's childish...

I live in Italy. It depends on the person. When i was in high school there were some people who judged me for my SA, but only during those years. But usually people will treat me and my problem (if they know about it or if they "see" it) in a gentle way. Nobody laughed at me or criticized me, in front of me. Maybe they talked behind me (like during high school) but they didnt criticized me in an explicit way. I think if you live in a big city or in a small town , it's different. In a small town you are more judged or criticized, everyone know everything about the others ( i live in a small country, near a city, so this is my experience). In a big city you dont know anyone, nobody cares about you unless they know you in person.

WRITING.TITLE: Scared by the future
WRITING.TEXT: I'm at my third and last year of university. I have many doubts regarding my future and i really don't know what will be next. I'm so scared of the thought of leaving university, leaving that city, i don't know what to do. I'm studying to become a social worker (this was the intention) but now i changed my idea and i think more about the profession of "social" educator (i don't know if it's the right name in english). And i have to do my thesis, i sent an email to one of my professors, and i have to do research for an argument, and im anxious, i only want to cry and do nothing, stay at home. The idea of working scares me. I did two apprenticeships with university which were mandatory and my anxiety blocked me. Last summer I worked a few weeks in a pizzeria but i quit because of my anxiety. I talked about this to my therapist, and she said that it's normal and many students don't know what to do next, they don't have an idea or a path to follow. She wants to "normalize" everything but i'm confused and i think i should have a clear idea.

I think nobody can save you. But you can. I spent many years of my life with this problem, and i never searched for help. During my teenage years i didnt know that i had SA, i couldn't find a solution to my problem. I became more aware after high school, and now i found the courage and started therapy. I found a very gentle person, and i like her. So i think you should find the courage, seek help, this step worked for me. But the therapist alone can't help you. She can support and encourage you, but I have to put effort, somedays it's really hard. But if i'm not motivated, i can't solve my problem. So i think that a therapist (or other people) can encourage you, but you have to do the work.
Thanks for your answer :)

WRITING.TITLE: Scared my therapist will leave me
WRITING.TEXT: I'm in therapy for my social anxiety, and i did 5 sessions. At the beginning I didn't like my therapist so much, i found her irritating, without a reason. Then after 2 sessions, one day she arrived 20 mins late. And then i panicked, i started to think "ok, this means she hates me\ she doesnt want to see me!". In that moment, i realized that i was afraid that she will leave me. I was afraid she would judge\criticize me, then leave me. And now i think i have like a crush on her, this week i spent the day with this thought in mind "i dont want to stop therapy, how can i live without it, what if i will have a relapse?" and i cried thinking that one day i won't see my T anymore. I realized this is a common pattern of me. I have this fear that other people will criticize me or they won't accept me, and this means that they will leave. I really want to tell my T about that, about me having "feelings" for her and about my irrational fear. I'm so scared, i think maybe i will say a stupid thing, i feel ashamed.
Did you tell him about that? What was the reaction?
Ok thanks ;) I'm going to tell mine today...

I told her! Today I was really anxious at the point of shaking! She didn't judge me I told her some details and at the end I said that I hope I don't think too much about therapy (and her) during the week. It's an obsession. She told me pretty much the same, that first we are going to work on my social anxiety. And then in the future about this second thing , only if I want (what does she means,of course I want to work trough this transference, because I felt bad and anxious!)
Italy

I felt like this. It sucks. You don't have to stay like this forever! I think you should make a step, and try to reach for help...i started therapy 1 month ago and it was the best decision i ever made! even if my SA isn't improved a lot...but you have to start with small steps.

WRITING.TEXT: I'm really anxious when I have therapy. It's not the therapist, I like her and now I feel love towards her too! I'm curious! I'll try the app....this is a common pattern for me too. I'm afraid that others will find me boring, annoying, and so that's why i tend to isolate myself. But at the same point i really crave the connection with others.

No, it helps me to feel less alone with my problem.

WRITING.TITLE: Silence in therapy made me angry
WRITING.TEXT: I wrote some post about how i was feeling bad, and hurt after my therapist session. I had the impression that my T didn't care about me, found me annoying or boring, and i was scared (and i am right now) that she didn't want me. I'm terrified she will leave me. So i felt anger towards her. Great. Now i think that all of this came up because she stayed silent more than usual. I hate silences in therapy...i didn't know what i was supposed to say, maybe she wanted me to break the silence? So, i associated the fact of her being silent, with the thought "she hates me\i'm boring etc". I want to write about it because i was obsessed with it, i felt bad, but now i'm feeling a bit better.
Yeah, maybe she wanted me to take the initiative, because usually she always start first and asks me questions. Because i don't know where to start :D Or maybe she was simply tired.

I'm going to tell her. I have the right to do it, but i'm scared of her reaction. I think all of this is connected with my transference with her. She doesn't know, i dropped some hints during our conversations, but i have to be explicit. I don't know if she will focus on transference, she does cbt, i heard that cbt therapist don't focus so much on tranference and feelings.

I think the root of my anxiety might be my fear of abandonment, of making connection with others and i'm scared they will leave. I was thinking this...maybe my anxiety is like a defense, if i'm anxious around people i won't stay with them, so it may prevent them from leaving (?). But it's too complicated!

I'm thinking that for me it depens on the behaviours of other people too. For example, if i (an introvert with social anxiety) talk to a person similar to me (introvert, shy) i have more problems, i can't open up, because the other person is like me too, maybe he\she doesn't know what to say, and me neither! But, if i talk to an extrovert, or a person who is funny, or who talks with everyone, i feel less judged and i'm more able to open up. Because that person always knows what to say, and i tend to "imitate" her\his behaviour (so i'll talk more, or be more funny, or laugh...).

Yeah I have the same impression! And i find that when i'm able to speak more naturally with others (like i do when i'm alone or with family) i act more spontaneously! It's a bit difficult but i'll try more this week!

It can be a good exposure exercise! If you have friends or anyone in your family you can ask them and go to the gym together. Maybe with someone that give you a sense of safety. Or you can go when it's very early or one hour before the closure.

Watch your phone

WRITING.TITLE: I want to change my carrier because of my SA?
WRITING.TEXT: I'm an italian university student. 3 years ago i had to choose a university. I decided to do social work, which is 3 years long. During the 2nd year we had to do two apprenticeships. During my second one, i started to have serious problems because of my SA. Then this 3d year i did another apprenticeship, but i quit it because of my SA. I started to think that maybe i don't like very much social work, the profession itself. I wanted to choose another "path" after this university, which is social educator. I really want to do a work where i will help people with their problems. For me social educator was different from social worker. During my last session with my therapist, we spoke about that. I said to her "I'm scared about my future, i don't know what to do anymore!" and I also said this sentence:" If i were extroverted, i'd become a social worker!". So my therapist said to me "This sentence is important, because it's like you think that you can't do this work because you have SA, or you are shy...But if you didnt have this problem, you would do that without doubts!". That's true. She told me to see if i want to change carrier only because of my SA. I don't know if i'm making sense. ._. I don't know how to explain this properly. But any of you felt like this? Its like i want to run from this work, to escape from it because i think i can't stand it if i have SA.
